intro: Cyphia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf cyphia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Cyphia tenuifolia is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing nectar for pollinators.
